intro: Jacquemontia cearensis, commonly known as the Cearense Moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique blooming pattern and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
